info.title: Repository Service
info.description: Repository Service API performs CRUD actions against repository resources

get.summary: ListRepositories gets a list of all configured repositories

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: Repo URL for query.

parameters.name: forceRefresh
parameters.description: Whether to force a cache refresh on repo's connection state.

post.summary: CreateRepository creates a new repository configuration

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Repository definition

parameters.name: upsert
parameters.description: Whether to create in upsert mode.

parameters.name: credsOnly
parameters.description: Whether to operate on credential set instead of repository.

parameters.name: repo.repo
parameters.description: Repo contains the URL to the remote repository

get.summary: Get returns a repository or its credentials

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: Repo URL for query

parameters.name: forceRefresh
parameters.description: Whether to force a cache refresh on repo's connection state.

delete.summary: DeleteRepository deletes a repository from the configuration

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: Repo URL for query

parameters.name: forceRefresh
parameters.description: Whether to force a cache refresh on repo's connection state.

get.summary: ListApps returns list of apps in the repo
GetHelmCharts returns list of helm charts in the specified repository

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: Repo URL for query

parameters.name: forceRefresh
parameters.description: Whether to force a cache refresh on repo's connection state.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: Repo URL for query

parameters.name: forceRefresh
parameters.description: Whether to force a cache refresh on repo's connection state.

post.summary: ValidateAccess validates access to a repository with given parameters

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The URL to the repo

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The URL to the repo

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username for accessing repo.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Password for accessing repo.

parameters.name: sshPrivateKey
parameters.description: Private key data for accessing SSH repository.

parameters.name: insecure
parameters.description: Whether to skip certificate or host key validation.

parameters.name: tlsClientCertData
parameters.description: TLS client cert data for accessing HTTPS repository.

parameters.name: tlsClientCertKey
parameters.description: TLS client cert key for accessing HTTPS repository.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the repo.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the repo.

parameters.name: enableOci
parameters.description: Whether helm-oci support should be enabled for this repo.

parameters.name: githubAppPrivateKey
parameters.description: Github App Private Key PEM data.

parameters.name: githubAppID
parameters.description: Github App ID of the app used to access the repo.

parameters.name: githubAppInstallationID
parameters.description: Github App Installation ID of the installed GitHub App.

parameters.name: githubAppEnterpriseBaseUrl
parameters.description: Github App Enterprise base url if empty will default to https://api.github.com.

parameters.name: proxy
parameters.description: HTTP/HTTPS proxy to access the repository.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Reference between project and repository that allow you automatically to be added as item inside SourceRepos project entity.

parameters.name: gcpServiceAccountKey
parameters.description: Google Cloud Platform service account key.

parameters.name: forceHttpBasicAuth
parameters.description: Whether to force HTTP basic auth.

post.summary: GetAppDetails returns application details by given path

parameters.name: source.repoURL
parameters.description: RepoURL is the URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests

name.title: Name is the name of the variable, usually expressed in uppercase

value.title: Value is the value of the variable

applicationv1alpha1EnvEntry.title: EnvEntry represents an entry in the application's environment

repositoryAppInfo.title: AppInfo contains application type and app file path

repositoryHelmAppSpec.title: HelmAppSpec contains helm app name  in source repo

images.description: images is a list of available images.

name.description: name is the name identifying a parameter.

title.description: title is a human-readable text of the parameter name.

tooltip.description: tooltip is a human-readable description of the parameter.

required.description: required defines if this given parameter is mandatory.

itemType.description:
itemType determines the primitive data type represented by the parameter. Parameters are always encoded as
strings, but this field lets them be interpreted as other primitive types.

collectionType.description:
collectionType is the type of value this parameter holds - either a single value (a string) or a collection
(array or map). If collectionType is set, only the field with that type will be used. If collectionType is not
set, `string` is the default. If collectionType is set to an invalid value, a validation error is thrown.

string.description: string is the default value of the parameter if the parameter is a string.

array.description: array is the default value of the parameter if the parameter is an array.

map.description: map is the default value of the parameter if the parameter is a map.

repositoryPluginAppSpec.title: PluginAppSpec contains details about a plugin-type Application

repositoryRefs.title: A subset of the repository's named refs

repositoryRepoAppDetailsQuery.title: RepoAppDetailsQuery contains query information for app details request

repositoryRepoAppsResponse.title: RepoAppsResponse contains applications of specified repository

selfLink.title:
Deprecated: selfLink is a legacy read-only field that is no longer populated by the system.
+optional

resourceVersion.title:
String that identifies the server's internal version of this object that
can be used by clients to determine when objects have changed.
Value must be treated as opaque by clients and passed unmodified back to the server.
Populated by the system.
Read-only.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency
+optional

continue.description:
continue may be set if the user set a limit on the number of items returned, and indicates that
the server has more data available. The value is opaque and may be used to issue another request
to the endpoint that served this list to retrieve the next set of available objects. Continuing a
consistent list may not be possible if the server configuration has changed or more than a few
minutes have passed. The resourceVersion field returned when using this continue value will be
identical to the value in the first response, unless you have received this token from an error
message.

remainingItemCount.title:
remainingItemCount is the number of subsequent items in the list which are not included in this
list response. If the list request contained label or field selectors, then the number of
remaining items is unknown and the field will be left unset and omitted during serialization.
If the list is complete (either because it is not chunking or because this is the last chunk),
then there are no more remaining items and this field will be left unset and omitted during
serialization.
Servers older than v1.15 do not set this field.
The intended use of the remainingItemCount is *estimating* the size of a collection. Clients
should not rely on the remainingItemCount to be set or to be exact.
+optional

v1ListMeta.description:
ListMeta describes metadata that synthetic resources must have, including lists and
various status objects. A resource may have only one of {ObjectMeta, ListMeta}.

seconds.description:
Represents seconds of UTC time since Unix epoch
1970-01-01T00:00:00Z. Must be from 0001-01-01T00:00:00Z to
9999-12-31T23:59:59Z inclusive.

nanos.description:
Non-negative fractions of a second at nanosecond resolution. Negative
second values with fractions must still have non-negative nanos values
that count forward in time. Must be from 0 to 999,999,999
inclusive. This field may be limited in precision depending on context.

v1Time.description:
Time is a wrapper around time.Time which supports correct
marshaling to YAML and JSON.  Wrappers are provided for many
of the factory methods that the time package offers.

+protobuf.options.marshal=false
+protobuf.as=Timestamp
+protobuf.options.(gogoproto.goproto_stringer)=false

repoURL.title: RepoURL is the URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests

path.description: Path is a directory path within the Git repository, and is only valid for applications sourced from Git.

targetRevision.description:
TargetRevision defines the revision of the source to sync the application to.
In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD.
In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

plugin.title: Plugin holds config management plugin specific options

chart.description: Chart is a Helm chart name, and must be specified for applications sourced from a Helm repo.

ref.description: Ref is reference to another source within sources field. This field will not be used if used with a `source` tag.

v1alpha1ApplicationSource.title: ApplicationSource contains all required information about the source of an application

recurse.title: Recurse specifies whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests

jsonnet.title: Jsonnet holds options specific to Jsonnet

exclude.title: Exclude contains a glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation

include.title: Include contains a glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation

v1alpha1ApplicationSourceDirectory.title: ApplicationSourceDirectory holds options for applications of type plain YAML or Jsonnet

valueFiles.title: ValuesFiles is a list of Helm value files to use when generating a template

parameters.title: Parameters is a list of Helm parameters which are passed to the helm template command upon manifest generation

releaseName.title: ReleaseName is the Helm release name to use. If omitted it will use the application name

values.title: Values specifies Helm values to be passed to helm template, typically defined as a block

fileParameters.title: FileParameters are file parameters to the helm template

version.title: Version is the Helm version to use for templating ("3")

passCredentials.title: PassCredentials pass credentials to all domains (Helm's --pass-credentials)

ignoreMissingValueFiles.title: IgnoreMissingValueFiles prevents helm template from failing when valueFiles do not exist locally by not appending them to helm template --values

skipCrds.title: SkipCrds skips custom resource definition installation step (Helm's --skip-crds)

extVars.title: ExtVars is a list of Jsonnet External Variables

tlas.title: TLAS is a list of Jsonnet Top-level Arguments

v1alpha1ApplicationSourceJsonnet.title: ApplicationSourceJsonnet holds options specific to applications of type Jsonnet

namePrefix.title: NamePrefix is a prefix appended to resources for Kustomize apps

nameSuffix.title: NameSuffix is a suffix appended to resources for Kustomize apps

images.title: Images is a list of Kustomize image override specifications

commonLabels.title: CommonLabels is a list of additional labels to add to rendered manifests

version.title: Version controls which version of Kustomize to use for rendering manifests

commonAnnotations.title: CommonAnnotations is a list of additional annotations to add to rendered manifests

forceCommonLabels.title: ForceCommonLabels specifies whether to force applying common labels to resources for Kustomize apps

forceCommonAnnotations.title: ForceCommonAnnotations specifies whether to force applying common annotations to resources for Kustomize apps

forceNamespace.title: ForceNamespace if true, will use the application's destination namespace as a kustomization file namespace

components.title: Components specifies a list of kustomize components to add to the kustmization before building

v1alpha1ApplicationSourceKustomize.title: ApplicationSourceKustomize holds options specific to an Application source specific to Kustomize

v1alpha1ApplicationSourcePlugin.title: ApplicationSourcePlugin holds options specific to config management plugins

name.description: Name is the name identifying a parameter.

string.description: String_ is the value of a string type parameter.

map.description: Map is the value of a map type parameter.

array.description: Array is the value of an array type parameter.

status.title: Status contains the current status indicator for the connection

message.title: Message contains human readable information about the connection status

attemptedAt.title: ModifiedAt contains the timestamp when this connection status has been determined

v1alpha1ConnectionState.title: ConnectionState contains information about remote resource connection state, currently used for clusters and repositories

name.title: Name is the name of the Helm parameter

path.title: Path is the path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter

v1alpha1HelmFileParameter.title: HelmFileParameter is a file parameter that's passed to helm template during manifest generation

name.title: Name is the name of the Helm parameter

value.title: Value is the value for the Helm parameter

forceString.title: ForceString determines whether to tell Helm to interpret booleans and numbers as strings

v1alpha1HelmParameter.title: HelmParameter is a parameter that's passed to helm template during manifest generation

v1alpha1JsonnetVar.title: JsonnetVar represents a variable to be passed to jsonnet during manifest generation

repo.title: Repo contains the URL to the remote repository

username.title: Username contains the user name used for authenticating at the remote repository

password.title: Password contains the password or PAT used for authenticating at the remote repository

sshPrivateKey.description: SSHPrivateKey contains the PEM data for authenticating at the repo server. Only used with Git repos.

connectionState.title: ConnectionState contains information about the current state of connection to the repository server

insecureIgnoreHostKey.title:
InsecureIgnoreHostKey should not be used anymore, Insecure is favoured
Used only for Git repos

insecure.title: Insecure specifies whether the connection to the repository ignores any errors when verifying TLS certificates or SSH host keys

enableLfs.description: EnableLFS specifies whether git-lfs support should be enabled for this repo. Only valid for Git repositories.

tlsClientCertData.title: TLSClientCertData contains a certificate in PEM format for authenticating at the repo server

tlsClientCertKey.title: TLSClientCertKey contains a private key in PEM format for authenticating at the repo server

type.description: Type specifies the type of the repo. Can be either "git" or "helm. "git" is assumed if empty or absent.

name.title: Name specifies a name to be used for this repo. Only used with Helm repos

inheritedCreds.title: Whether credentials were inherited from a credential set

enableOCI.title: EnableOCI specifies whether helm-oci support should be enabled for this repo

githubAppPrivateKey.title: Github App Private Key PEM data

githubAppID.title: GithubAppId specifies the ID of the GitHub app used to access the repo

githubAppInstallationID.title: GithubAppInstallationId specifies the installation ID of the GitHub App used to access the repo

githubAppEnterpriseBaseUrl.title: GithubAppEnterpriseBaseURL specifies the base URL of GitHub Enterprise installation. If empty will default to https://api.github.com

proxy.title: Proxy specifies the HTTP/HTTPS proxy used to access the repo

project.title: Reference between project and repository that allow you automatically to be added as item inside SourceRepos project entity

gcpServiceAccountKey.title: GCPServiceAccountKey specifies the service account key in JSON format to be used for getting credentials to Google Cloud Source repos

forceHttpBasicAuth.title: ForceHttpBasicAuth specifies whether Argo CD should attempt to force basic auth for HTTP connections

v1alpha1Repository.title: Repository is a repository holding application configurations

v1alpha1RepositoryList.description: RepositoryList is a collection of Repositories.
